title: Flagg makes 'winning plays' in uneven debut
content: Cooper Flagg made his professional debut Thursday night in the NBA summer league and celebrated an 87-85 win over Bronny James and the Lakers.

title: Agent: Bolts' Harris hurt eye in fireworks incident
content: Najee Harris suffered an eye injury in a July 4 fireworks incident, but his agent said the Chargers running back "is fully expected to be ready for the upcoming NFL season."

title: Yanks, no-hit through 7, down 5-0, rally past M's
content: Anthony Volpe scored with an acrobatic slide on Aaron Judge's sacrifice fly in the 10th inning, and the Yankees rallied past Seattle after being no-hit for seven innings.

title: Pelicans, Jones agree to 3-year, $68M extension
content: Pelicans forward Herb Jones has agreed to a three-year, $68 million contract extension with the franchise.

title: NCAA says March Madness expansion 'still viable'
content: The committees for men's and women's Division I basketball met this week to discuss possible expansion of the March Madness tournaments, but made no immediate decisions or recommendations.

title: Bregman 'in a great place,' to return for Red Sox
content: Red Sox third baseman Alex Bregman, who has been sidelined since May 24 with a strained right quad, will "play this weekend," manager Alex Cora said.

title: Mets' Peterson gets 1st ASG nod as sub for Ray
content: Mets pitcher David Peterson was added to the National League roster for the All-Star Game on Thursday, replacing Giants left-hander Robbie Ray.

title: Fore! Barkley is longest shot in celeb golf tourney
content: Charles Barkley, who finished a career-best 58th last year, remains the biggest long shot to win this week's American Century Championship celebrity golf tournament.

title: 📸 Dodgers unveil Kobe Bryant bobblehead
content: The first 40,000 ticketed fans for the Dodgers' matchup against the Blue Jays on Aug. 8 will receive the bobblehead.

title: College football's top 25 teams have their archvillains, and we have a pick for each
content: These are the players, coaches, teams and concepts that every squad in our Way-Too-Early Top 25 will be looking out for in 2025.

title: We graded the offseason: Here's who crushed it and flubbed it, from the Rams (A) to the Saints (D)
content: We handed out offseason report cards to all 32 NFL teams, factoring in signings, extensions, trades, draft picks, hirings -- you name it.

title: The perfect trade deadline addition for every MLB contender
content: A star outfielder to the NL West? A powerful slugger dealt to New York? We make moves for every World Series hopeful.

content: There are 23 five-stars in the Class of 2026. We look at how they got to their teams and what they'll do in college.

content: Who are the best safeties in the NFL? Execs, coaches and scouts from around the league ranked their top 10 in our annual summer series.

content: The Blue Jays and Cubs debut at their highest rankings of 2025, while the Yankees' fall continues. Here's who's hot -- and who's not -- ahead of baseball's midseason break.

title: Two A's and how many F's?! Midseason grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: From the contenders acing 2025 to the first-half failures, we take a look at every club's performance.

title: Home Run Derby odds: Raleigh the top choice, Acuna not far behind
content: Will Cal Raleigh take the Derby crown? Maybe Ronald Acuna takes advantage of home cooking. Here are the odds for each participant in this year's event.

title: Is the United States too hot to handle the 2026 FIFA Men's World Cup?
content: The 2025 Club World Cup has been punctuated by a brutal heat wave in the U.S. that has left players and coaches flustered. The bigger question: What will such weather do for next summer's World Cup?

title: What the Gold Cup revealed about the USMNT's World Cup hopes
content: The summer got off to a rocky start for the U.S. men's national team, but by the end of the Gold Cup, Mauricio Pochettino's foundations had taken shape.

title: Source: Seattle signs Fishel to record NWSL deal
content: Seattle Reign FC has signed United States women's national team forward Mia Fishel on a transfer from Chelsea.

title: Bale backs Alonso to make 'big changes' at Madrid
content: Former Real Madrid star Gareth Bale has backed new head coach Xabi Alonso to make "big changes" at the club, saying that he won't be afraid to drop anyone.

title: Wenger doesn't 'share Klopp's view' of CWC
content: Arsene Wenger has dismissed Jurgen Klopp's criticism of FIFA's revamped 32-team Club World Cup, calling the tournament a "fantastic competition" and emphasising the support it has received from participating teams, players, and managers. Klopp, the...

title: USWNT great Tobin Heath announces retirement
content: USWNT great Tobin Heath has announced her retirement from soccer, almost three years after her last appearance.

title: Source: Smith set for world-record Arsenal transfer
content: Olivia Smith is set to become the first player in the women's game to command a transfer fee of £1 million as Arsenal seek to secure her signature from Liverpool, a source has told ESPN.

title: Tottenham complete Kudus signing from West Ham
content: Tottenham Hotspur have completed the signing of midfielder Mohammed Kudus from West Ham United, the clubs announced Thursday.

title: AC Milan-Como in Oz? Italy's FA approves request
content: AC Milan's Serie A match vs Como could be Europe's first major league game played abroad after Italy's FA approved plans to stage it in Australia.

title: USMNT's Vázquez tears ACL, blow to WC hopes
content: Austin forward Brandon Vázquez tore his right ACL, an injury that will hamper his chances of making the United States roster for next year's World Cup.

title: ⚽ 'To New York': Chelsea hit back at Flamengo
content: Flamengo's social media account trolled Chelsea multiple times after defeating them in the CWC group stage.

title: New East tiers: How injuries, offseason movement reshaped the conference
content: From injured superstars to play-in teams making major splashes, Chris Herring runs down every team's outlook for 2025-26.

title: Katie Taylor ready to complete Amanda Serrano trilogy at MSG
content: With her junior welterweight title on the line in a legendary rivalry, the champ reflects on a life in boxing.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Former heavyweight title contender Derrick Lewis is back
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? MMA analysts and former UFC fighters Anthony Smith and Din Thomas make their picks.

title: Who is Red Bull's new boss, and can he keep Max?
content: In the wake of Red Bull's bombshell decision to sack Christian Horner this week, it was easy to miss the name of the man replacing him: Laurent Mekies.

title: 50 days, 50 states: Durant, Reese headline top hoopers from D.C.-area high schools
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of D.C., Maryland and Virginia based on career achievements, legacy and lasting impact on the game.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal submit bid for Chelsea's Noni Madueke
content: Arsenal have made an initial offer for Chelsea's Noni Madueke. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Some execs call it "crazy" and "dangerous" but NWSL aims to be 32-team league like NFL
content: "Crazy," "dangerous" or inevitable? The NWSL's commissioner vows to follow the NFL's path to 32 teams. But questions linger, including from execs inside the league.

title: 'Living off daughter's income': Father fired 3 bullets at tennis coach; insecurity suspected as motive
content: In a shocking incident in Gurgaon, junior international tennis player Radhika Yadav was allegedly shot dead by her father, Deepak Yadav, at their home. Police arrested Deepak, who confessed to the murder, citing disagreements over Radhika's tennis academy. Neighbors and friends expressed disbelief, recalling Deepak's support for her career.

title: Shrimp cocktails, crackers & more: Shubhanshu Shukla's joyful dinner on space station; see pics
content: Indian Air Force Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, part of the Ax-4 mission, is set to return to Earth after an unforgettable evening on the ISS. The crew, including Shukla, shared a meal and stories, celebrating international collaboration in space. Shukla made history as the first Indian on a private ISS mission, contributing to over 60 experiments.

title: 50% tariff & 'witch hunt' cry: Why Trump is going all-out against Brazil
content: Donald Trump's 50% tariff on Brazilian imports has ignited a diplomatic clash with President Lula, who decried “tutelage” and vowed retaliation. Trump defends Bolsonaro amidst his trial for allegedly plotting a coup, claiming it's a disgrace. Despite a US trade surplus with Brazil, Trump cites national security and copper imports as justification.

title: Bill Ackman jumps on Zohran's father's 'suicide bomber' theory
content: Bill Ackman criticized Zohran Mamdani, a New York City mayoral candidate. This happened after Zohran's father, Mahmood Mamdani's old views resurfaced. Mahmood Mamdani had controversially called suicide bombers "soldiers" in his book. Ackman linked Zohran to his father's stance. Mahmood Mamdani defended his views in an old interview. He argued for understanding the context of political violence.

title: Intel in crisis: CEO Lip-Bu Tan to employees; customers giving failing grades
content: Intel's new CEO, Lip-Bu Tan, delivered a sobering assessment, acknowledging the company's decline in the semiconductor industry and its struggle to compete in the AI sector, particularly against Nvidia. He emphasized the importance of the 18A manufacturing process and a shift towards edge AI applications as crucial steps in Intel's turnaround, which he described as a "marathon."

title: Epstein Files: What is the Kash Patel honeypot conspiracy theory?
content: Ironically, one of the loudest voices once demanding full exposure of Epstein’s secrets – Kash Patel – now finds himself at the centre of an unproven conspiracy theory of his own. In the void left behind, conspiracy theories have rushed to fill the silence. Chief among them is the so-called “Kash Patel honeypot theory,” a narrative that blends espionage, personal relationships, and unresolved public trauma into a potent cocktail of suspicion.

title: Chhangur Baba empire' falls: ED probes Rs 51 cr received for religious conversions
content: The Enforcement Directorate has initiated a money laundering investigation against Jamaluddin alias Chhangur Baba, suspected of running an illegal religious conversion syndicate. This action follows the discovery of foreign remittances exceeding Rs 100 crore across numerous bank accounts linked to him and his associates.

title: Vadodara bridge tragedy: Trucks sunk in 10-feet slush; more bodies feared, 18 dead
content: The Gambhira bridge collapse near Vadodara has claimed 18 lives, with rescue teams recovering five more bodies from the Mahi river. Search operations continue for two missing individuals, hampered by thick mud and submerged vehicles. Authorities are working to remove the vehicles and stabilize a dangling tanker to prevent further delays and potential hazards during the recovery efforts.

title: Altman vs Zuckerberg: Sam Altman breaks silence on AI talent war; some people will …
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman addressed Meta's aggressive recruitment of his AI researchers, downplaying its impact despite internal concerns. While publicly maintaining a composed stance, Altman privately dismissed Meta's success, asserting that they didn't secure OpenAI's top talent. He emphasized OpenAI's mission-driven approach to retain employees, contrasting it with Meta's recruitment tactics, even as Zuckerberg's team successfully poached several researchers.

title: Trade war: Canada reacts after Trump slaps 35% tariffs; will US soften its stance?
content: Amid escalating trade tensions, Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney pledges to protect Canadian workers as the US imposes a 35% tariff hike on Canadian imports, citing concerns over fentanyl. Carney emphasizes Canada's efforts to combat fentanyl and diversify trade partnerships, highlighting strengthened ties with the UK. Trump warns against retaliation, urging companies to relocate to the US.

title: Gautam Gambhir responds to Virat Kohli’s criticism of BCCI’s rule
content: Gautam Gambhir supports the BCCI's new family rule, limiting family time during tournaments to maintain player focus, contrasting with Virat Kohli's disapproval. Gambhir emphasizes that representing the nation is the priority, not a holiday, highlighting his constant engagement with team strategies even after victories.

title: Gates vs Musk: Elon on why Bill Gates is 'really unhappy'; It’s not just about USAID cuts killing kids
content: Bill Gates expressed concerns over potential health aid cuts by the US government, warning of increased deaths. Elon Musk responded sharply, suggesting Gates' unhappiness stemmed from his organization losing US taxpayer funding. This exchange is the latest in a series of disagreements, fueled by Gates' past short position against Tesla stock, which reportedly cost him $1.5 billion.

title: Elon Musk’s Tesla to open first showroom in Mumbai
content: Tesla is poised to inaugurate its first showroom in Mumbai on July 15, marking its entry into the Indian automotive market. Tesla has shown no interest in establishing local production units, focusing solely on showrooms.

title: UP shocker: Woman gives country-made pistol to lover to kill husband
content: In Aligarh, a woman and her lover have been arrested in connection with the murder of her husband. Beena Devi allegedly provided Manoj Kumar with a country-made pistol, with which he shot and killed Suresh Kumar outside his home. The motive appears to be an illicit affair between Beena and Manoj, leading to frequent quarrels between the couple.

title: Income Tax Return: ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released - what taxpayers should know
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department has released excel utilities for ITR-2 and ITR-3, enabling taxpayers with capital gains and crypto income to file returns for AY 2025-26 by September 15, 2025. Key changes include revised capital gains schedules, updated asset/liability disclosure thresholds now applicable above ₹1 crore income, and mandatory TDS section code reporting.

title: Gisele Bündchen: 'Death of my dream' confession — sparks healing journey — post-Tom Brady divorce
content: Gisele Bundchen spoke about her divorce from Tom Brady in March 2024. She described it as the death of her dream. Bundchen dismissed media claims that Brady's return to football caused the split. She expressed continued support for Brady's happiness and success. Bundchen is focusing on her own truth and has grown close to Joaquim Valente.

title: Stefon Diggs fires back at ‘smelly BBL’ claim amid Cardi B breakup buzz
content: Stefon Diggs has refuted claims that he called Cardi B "smelly" due to her BBL, dismissing the rumors as false. This comes after Cardi B removed pictures from her Instagram, sparking breakup speculations among fans. Despite the rumors and cryptic social media posts, the couple seems to be going strong, with Diggs posting a video of them working out together.

title: Told to follow rules, students stab Haryana school principal to death
content: Jagbir Pannu, the principal of a senior secondary school in Hisar, Haryana, was murdered on Guru Purnima. Two minor students allegedly stabbed him on campus. The reason was that he asked them to get haircuts and follow school rules. The accused were students in classes 11 and 12. Police investigation suggests the motive was the principal's strict enforcement of discipline.

title: Magic Johnson dines in style with friends and family amidst a vacation spree
content: Magic Johnson, the NBA legend, is vacationing in Monaco with his wife and friends, indulging in the city's culinary delights. He recently dined at Mamo Michelangelo, enjoying a variety of dishes from pizzas to seafood. Johnson, who owns stakes in several sports teams, is taking a well-deserved break after the NBA Finals, as seen through his social media posts.

title: 10 Everyday habits that could lead to kidney damage without you knowing
content: Kidneys filter waste and manage blood pressure. Many lifestyle habits can damage them. Overusing painkillers and eating too much salt are harmful. Processed foods and dehydration also pose risks. Lack of sleep and excessive protein add to the problems. Small changes can protect kidneys. Staying hydrated and eating whole foods are beneficial. Limiting salt, sugar, and alcohol is important.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 250 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday driven by increased global uncertainties due to Donald Trump’s tariff moves.

title: 'Disturbing', 'Had the prettiest smile': Tennis pros react to killing of Radhika Yadav, state level player, by father
content: Radhika Yadav, a former national-level tennis player, was fatally shot by her father, Deepak Yadav, in Gurugram. Deepak confessed, stating he was humiliated by villagers' taunts about living off his daughter's earnings from her tennis academy. This mockery, coupled with accusations against Radhika's character, drove him to commit the heinous act using his licensed revolver.

title: 'Monojit in our hearts': Weeks after gangrape, graffiti remains; college waiting for permission
content: A law college in Kolkata is facing criticism for a graffiti celebrating Monojit Mishra, who is accused of raping a student on campus. Despite the vice principal claiming awareness of the graffiti since February, it remained untouched until the incident in June.

title: Bitcoin hits record high of $116,046; surges 24% this year
content: Bitcoin surged to a new peak of $116,046.44 on Thursday, fueled by strong institutional demand and supportive crypto policies under the Trump administration. This rally marks a 24% increase for the cryptocurrency in 2025. Ethereum and altcoins like Solana, Dogecoin, and Cardano also experienced gains.

title: Trump to attend FIFA Club World Cup Final as Chelsea prepares for title match
content: Donald Trump has confirmed his attendance at the FIFA Club World Cup Final on July 14, 2025, at MetLife Stadium, where Chelsea will compete against either Real Madrid or Paris Saint-Germain. This announcement has generated significant buzz among football enthusiasts and political observers alike. The high-profile match is expected to draw a sold-out crowd and global attention.

title: Why was state-level tennis player Radhika killed by her father? Police answer motive
content: In Gurugram, tennis player Radhika Yadav, 25, was fatally shot by her father, Deepak Yadav, 49, at their residence in Sector 57. Using his licensed revolver, Deepak fired multiple shots, with three striking Radhika. Gurugram Police have arrested Deepak and charged him with murder. The incident followed an argument regarding Radhika's tennis academy, which her father opposed.

title: Aaron Rodgers clashes with Steelers coaches as Bettis says team lost soul
content: Hall of Famer Jerome Bettis is concerned about the Pittsburgh Steelers' potential identity shift after acquiring Aaron Rodgers and DK Metcalf. Bettis emphasizes the importance of maintaining a run-first approach, despite Rodgers' preference for a pass-heavy offense. The clash between Rodgers' style and offensive coordinator Arthur Smith's ground-focused scheme raises questions about the team's future success.

title: Hyderabad horror: Woman, daughter, her lover kill man; dump body in lake after watching movie
content: In Hyderabad, a security guard was allegedly murdered by his wife and daughter, aided by the daughter's lover. The trio, identified as Vadluri Sharadha, Manisha, and Mohammed Javeed Hussain, reportedly killed Lingam at their residence in Musheerabad.

title: 5 early symptoms of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease
content: Pain or discomfort on the upper right side of the abdomen just below the ribs, is also a warning sign of NAFLD. Since the liver is located here, the pain is felt as a dull or aching sensation, which can be interpreted as digestive problems or a muscle strain. This happens due to inflammation of the fat, resulting in tissue damage

title: Suneel Darshan calls Deepika Padukone's alleged 8-hour workdays demand 'unreal'
content: Veteran filmmaker Suneel Darshan has reacted to the ongoing debate surrounding actress Deepika Padukone’s alleged demand for an 8-hour work shift, calling the idea “unreal” and impractical in the current filmmaking landscape. Deepika’s preference for an 8-hour shooting schedule became a topic of discussion after her exit from Sandeep Reddy Vanga’s Spirit starring Prabhas.

title: Chess: Carlsen beats ChatGPT without losing a piece, AI tool predicts his FIDE Rating
content: Magnus Carlsen, the world's top chess player, defeated OpenAI's ChatGPT in a game, he claimed in a social media post. He shared screenshots of his dominant win on X. Carlsen humorously noted he sometimes gets bored while traveling and plays chess with the artificial intelligence model. The AI tool estimated Carlsen's classical rating strength far below his actual FIDE rating.

title: Astrologer warns of breakup between Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce
content: Astrologer Mark Du Boise predicts potential heartbreak for Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, despite their public displays of affection. Du Boise cites conflicting astrological signs, suggesting Swift's inner tension and Kelce's hesitation could doom their relationship. While fans remain optimistic, the astrologer's claims have sparked debate, but the couple continues to showcase their bond.

title: Wayne Gretzky’s daughter-in-law shares emotional birthday message to Ty Gretzky
content: Wayne Gretzky's son, Ty Gretzky, recently celebrated his 35th birthday. Sara Gretzky shared family moments on Instagram. The couple married on February 29, 2020. Ty co-founded The Gretzky Hockey School in 2014. Sara responded to the Texas floods on social media. The Gretzky family continues to impact the community. The family leads with heart.

title: 'Gautam Gambhir is not important' — Team India head coach on culture
content: Indian head coach Gautam Gambhir champions first-class cricket as vital for building a strong national team. Speaking with Cheteshwar Pujara, he stressed daily effort, growth, and pride in representing India. Gambhir highlighted the importance of team culture and feedback, emphasizing that Indian cricket takes precedence over individual concerns.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: Jadeja teases Root on 99 with fake fumble — Watch
content: Joe Root's unbeaten 99 highlighted the first day of the third Test at Lord's, where England reached 251 for four. A moment of levity occurred when Ravindra Jadeja playfully feigned a fumble, teasing Root near his century. Root's patient innings anchored England's batting, contrasting with their usual aggressive style.

title: Mamata-Tata reset? 17 years after Tata said 'bye bye’ to Bengal, Mamata meets chairman
content: Tata Group chairman N Chandrasekaran's meeting with West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee in Kolkata signals a potential thaw in relations after 17 years since the Nano project's Singur exit. Banerjee expressed Bengal's commitment to fostering public-private partnerships for industrial growth.

title: 2 US Citizens, Stranded Near Nicobar Islands, Rescued By Indian Coast Guard
content: The Indian Coast Guard rescued two United States nationals stranded about 53 miles south of the Nicobar Islands, officials said on Friday.

title: Woman Swings 'Trishul' At Brother-In-Law. He Dodges, But It Kills His Baby
content: An 11-month-old baby was killed during a domestic dispute in a village in Maharashtra's Ahmednagar district on Thursday, after a trishul or trident struck the child on the head.

title: Air India Crash Probe To Offer Peek Into Jet's Final Moments
content: A month after the worst aviation accident in India in decades, authorities are poised to release a preliminary report into the Air India crash.

title: Indore's Central Jail To Sell Spices Made By Prisoners
content: Inmates of the Indore Central Jail will soon be making spices which would be available for the outside world too, besides the prison's own kitchen.

title: India's Finest Mangoes Showcased In Seattle
content: Seattle got a taste of the best of Indian mangoes at a special event hosted to showcase a variety of the popular fruit and explore opportunities for wider availability of premium mangoes from India in the regional market.

title: Hydroponic Weed Worth Rs 33.35 Crore Seized At Mumbai Airport, 8 Arrested
content: Mumbai Customs has seized 33.35 kilograms of hydroponic weed valued at Rs 33.35 crore over three days, leading to the arrest of eight persons in six cases, officials have said.

title: A US Link Found In Alia Bhatt Fraud Case. What Police Said
content: Alia Bhatt's former personal assistant allegedly leaked confidential information related to her production house Eternal Sunshine Productions to an unknown US resident and had duped the Bollywood actor of Rs 77 lakh, police said.

title: "Thought It Was Ice": Man Finds Glass In Bun Maska At Pune's Goodluck Cafe
content: A shocking incident has come to light at Pune's legendary Goodluck Irani Cafe, where a customer reportedly found pieces of glass in Bun Maska.

title: Japan's Internet Is So Fast, It Can Download All Of Netflix In 1 Second
content: It's not just the high-speed rail network, the best airports and earthquake-resistant buildings. Japan has added another feather to its infrastructural cap - it now boasts the world's fastest Internet.

title: A Music Video Surfaces Amid Probe Into Tennis Player's Murder By Father
content: The 25-year-old national-level tennis player, Radhika Yadav, who was shot dead by her father at their residence in Gurugram on Thursday, was allegedly killed following months of tensions within the family.

title: Sena MLA Who Slapped Canteen Staff Over Stale Food Targets South Indians
content: Marathis would have never shown any laxity in serving fresh food if they were allowed to run the canteen at the MLAs hostel in Mumbai, Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad has said, after he assaulted a staff member for allegedly serving him stale food.

title: "Processing This Shock, Not Giving Up": Kapil Sharma's Cafe On Shooting
content: A day after the shooting, Kap's Cafe shared a message "from the heart" stating the team is "processing this shock" but "not giving up".

title: Jane Birkin's Hermes Bag Sold For Rs 85 Crore At Paris Auction
content: The first-ever Birkin bag designed by French luxury brand Hermes for celebrity Jane Birkin sold for 8.58 million euros ($10 million) at a Sotheby's auction in Paris on Thursday, smashing previous price records for a handbag.

title: 9 Bus Passengers Kidnapped, Shot Dead In Balochistan
content: Armed men killed nine bus passengers after kidnapping them in Pakistan's southwestern Balochistan province, officials said on Friday.

title: "Heard Loud Sound, Then...": What Murdered Tennis Player's Uncle Saw
content: Radhika Yadav was found lying in a pool of blood in the kitchen and a 32 bore revolver was found in the drawing room, seconds after the 25-year-old was shot dead by her father Deepak Yadav at their house in Gurugram on Thursday, her uncle said.

title: Firm Friends To BRICS Brawl: What's Behind Trump's 50% Tariff On Brazil
content: US President Donald Trump has announced a 50 percent tariff on Brazilian imports as he accused the country's leftist leadership of orchestrating a "witch hunt" against his right-wing ally, former leader Jair Bolsonaro.

title: Israel PM's "Might Of Our Heroic Army" Warning Amid Gaza Ceasefire Talks
content: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu signalled that Israel's war against Hamas is far from over, asserting that even a temporary ceasefire will not deter his government from pursuing its ultimate goal: the complete dismantling of Hamas's military.

title: Himachal Man Saves 4 Lives During Disaster, Daughter Shows Courage Too
content: A man and his daughter from a village in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district demonstrated rare courage during the dreadful night of June 30 by not only defeating death but also saving the lives of four people.

title: Pics: Shubhanshu Shukla Enjoys Feast On Space Station Ahead Of Homecoming
content: Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, who is on a 14-day mission to the International Space Station, is set to begin his return journey on July 14. Days before his homecoming, he and other crew members attended a feast, showed images from the orbiting lab

title: Donald Trump Plans 'Major' Statement On Russia, Mulls Sanctions
content: President Donald Trump said he plans to make a "major statement" on Russia, as the US prepares to send more American weapons to Ukraine via purchases from NATO allies.

title: Canada: Multiple rounds of shots fired at Kapil Sharma's cafe in Surrey
content: Kapil Sharma's new restaurant, KAP'S CAFE, in Surrey, Canada, was targeted in a gunfire incident late Wednesday. Preliminary reports confirm multiple shots were fired, but no injuries occurred. Authorities have launched an investigation, sealing off the area. Harjit Singh Laddi, allegedly linked to Babbar Khalsa International, claimed responsibility, citing anger over Sharma's alleged remarks as the motive.

title: Wanted drug producer deported to India from UAE: CBI
content: Mustafa was chargesheeted in Mumbai and a special court had issued an open-dated arrest warrant against him

title: Controversial question in B.A. History exam in West Bengal’s Vidyasagar University sparks outrage
content: In the examination that took place on July 9, the question paper on Modern Nationalism of India carried a question that asked, “Name three district magistrates of Midnapore who were killed by terrorists,” apparently terming the freedom fighters as  “shontrashbadi” (terrorists).

title: RSS chief Bhagwat’s ‘stepping aside’ remark: What kind of homecoming is this for PM Modi, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh takes dig
content: During an event in Nagpur, RSS chief Bhagwat mentioned Sangh ideologue late Moropant Pingley's statement about stepping aside after 75 years of age

title: Woman caretaker kills retired AE; escapes with cash in Vijayawada’s NTR Colony
content: Venkata Rama Rao was staying with his ninety-year-old mother Saraswathi and engaged Anusha to take care of his mother

title: 10th batch of over 6,400 pilgrims leaves Jammu for twin base camps of Amarnath
content: Over 1.30 lakh pilgrims have paid obeisance at the shrine since the start of the 38-day annual yatra through the twin tracks of Pahalgam in Anantnag district and Baltal in Ganderbal district on July 3

title: Confusion over HSRP enforcement leaves Hyderabad commuters frustrated
content: What has sparked discontent is not the fine itself, but the lack of clarity on how to obtain HSRPs, especially for vehicles registered before the current system was introduced in 2019.

title: Indian Coast Guard rescues two U.S. nationals stranded at sea near Andaman and Nicobar islands
content: ICG Ship Rajveer reached the U.S.-flagged sailing vessel ‘Sea Angel’, established communication with the stranded crew, and conducted an on-site assessment

title: Ironical that an atheist nation like China wants to interfere in Dalai Lama succession: BJP MP
content: MPs across party lines are collecting signatures to petition Union government for a Bharat Ratna for the Dalai Lama

title: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister welcomes Supreme Court step to allow SIR of electoral roll
content: The Opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal said they welcomed Supreme Court asking EC to include Aadhar and other cards into SIT exercise

title: Mumbai’s Carnac Bridge renamed as Sindoor after Operation Sindoor
content: ‘The Sindoor is named after the success of Operation Sindoor to wipe the pages of India’s black history where the then Governor Carnac for years carried out atrocities against Indians, said Maharashtra CM Fadnavis,

title: IIT Kharagpur’s ‘campus mothers’ programme draws mixed response
content: While some have lauded the institute for promoting welfare initiatives, mental health professionals have raised concerns around its gendered nature and the ethics of confidentiality and non-judgement

title: Two pistols, 6 hand-grenades among consignment recovered in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch
content: A joint search operation was launched by the police, Special Operations Group, and the Army in the general area of Khanetar and adjoining areas in the district

title: Veteran statesman, former Council Chairman N. Tippanna passes away at 97
content: Tippanna mortal remains will be kept at his Ballari residence for public homage, and the final rites will be conducted on July 12, 2025 in his native village of Turuvanur in Chitradurga district

title: Three officials from NIMZ, Zaheerabad in ACB net
content: All three officers were arrested and produced before the special court for SPE and ACB cases in Nampally

title: Credit rating of Sigachi revised to ‘rating watch with negative implications’
content: The agency said it would continue to monitor the impact of the incident on revenue, profitability and cash flows and long-term impact, if any, of outcome from ongoing investigations

title: SI of Gachibowli women police station arrested by Telangana ACB
content: According to the ACB, the accused officer, identified as K.Y. Venu Gopal, demanded and received the bribe from a complainant in exchange for removing the name of the complainant’s mother from a case

title: Gujarat’s ‘Namo Lakshmi Yojana’ disburses ₹924 crore, benefits over 10 lakh girl students
content: Launched in 2024, the scheme provides ₹50,000 over four years to girls from families earning less than ₹6 lakh annually, helping them complete Classes 9 to 12

title: Nothing silky, smooth for sericulture farmers in Andhra Pradesh
content: Dearth of local markets, little government support and a devastating disorder that is rendering silkworms unable to spin cocoons have cornered sericulture farmers in Chebrolu, one of the largest mulberry plant cultivating belts in Andhra. As the crisis deepens, many have altogether abandoned the business, switching to cotton and oil palm, but some cling on to the hope that Chebrolu will survive and emerge as the State’s Silk City, writes T. Appala Naidu

title: Sigachi Industries explosion: A deafening blast, a lingering silence
content: On the morning of June 30, a powerful explosion tore through a chemical factory in Telangana’s Sangareddy district, its echo heard for kilometres. Forty-four workers were confirmed dead, over 30 injured, and at least eight remain missing. Most of the workforce were migrants, clocking long shifts for modest wages. As families gathered outside morgues and rescue zones, a grim picture began to emerge — of alleged ignored warnings, delayed responses and silence from those in charge, reports Naveen Kumar

title: Schools without rules in Bengaluru
content: From not being registered as per rules to not having land even to hold the morning assembly, many schools in Bengaluru are ‘unauthorised’ on several counts. But there is no consistent effort to monitor them and hold them to account

title: Review of ‘A House Without Cats and Other Stories: The Mozhi Prize Anthology 1’
content: The inaugural Mozhi Prize anthology, with nine Tamil stories in translation, highlights the diversity of tone and form in contemporary regional fiction

title: Column | Vikrant Bhise’s shades of blue
content: The artist is on a mission to take our 3,000-year history of caste-based oppression to a wider global audience

title: Chennai’s Madhya Kailash junction: only for the bravehearts among pedestrians
content: Pedestrians often form groups and cross the road amid traffic, sometimes dangerously, especially when vehicles take the bus bay side from Rajiv Gandhi Salai.

title: No income tax notice has been sent to Eknath Shinde’s son: Sources
content: “It may also kindly be noted no notice has been issued to Shri. Srikanth Shinde, son of Shri. Eknath Shinde,” the source clarified.

title: Bombay HC dismisses PIL challenging transfer of salt pan lands for Dharavi redevelopment project affected people
content: The lawyer Sagar Devre challenged the State’s decision to hand over the salt pan land parcel in Mulund, Kanjurmarg and Bhandup to Adani for a rental housing scheme for ineligible residents of Dharavi and the Union Ministry of Commerce and Industry’s Office Memorandum (OM), which enables the transfer of land.

title: Language ‘test’ for Assam’s Bengal-origin Muslims
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said Bengal-origin Muslims not listing Assamese as their mother tongue in public documents will help the government know the number of foreigners

title: Kerala High Court grants anticipatory bail to ED official
content: He allegedly demanded ₹2 crore as bribe through an intermediary from a cashew businessman to extricate him from a money-laundering case

title: Government failed to ensure MSP for key crops, alleges Jagan
content: Over 76,000 mango farmers cultivating in over 2.2 lakh acres have been forced to throw away their produce due to a lack of MSP, he asserts

title: Calcutta HC division bench upholds order banning ‘tainted’ candidates from WB school recruitment process
content: On July 7, the single bench of Justice Sougata Bhattacharya had  debarred ‘tainted’ candidates from the recruitment process conducted by WBSSC. The WB govt and WBSSC has approached the division bench against the single bench order.

title: Shivamogga resident moves Karnataka High Court on his plea for ‘B.S. Yediyurappa bridge’
content: The petitioner has said that he has given a representation to the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, and the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) on July 7 requesting them to name the new bridge, which is scheduled to be inaugurated on July 14, as “B.S. Yediyurappa” bridge considering the contribution of Mr. Yediyurappa to the State as Chief Minister.

title: ‘Relief for democracy’, says Congress on Supreme Court's suggestion on voter list revision in Bihar
content: Congress general secretary K.C. Venugopal says the court asking the EC to allow Aadhaar cards, ration cards and voter ID cards for the identification of voters during the special exercise is in itself a big thing

title: Maharashtra Assembly passes public security Bill; law won’t be misused: CM
content: Draft legislation tabled by CM approved by majority through voice vote after two-hour discussion; CPI opposes Bill, other Opposition parties raise objections; Bill will now be tabled in Legislative Council

title: Caught in violence while reporting on protests against violence
content: Hundreds of people come together at protests to express solidarity with the cause, but some also come with an agenda

title: Bihar Special Intensive Revision: The struggle to be counted
content: Even as political parties gear up for the Bihar Assembly election, due later this year, the Election Commission of India has announced a drive to revise the voter list in the State. With just a month’s time for 7.90 crore adults to fill in the enumeration forms, the entire State machinery has been deployed to carry out this exercise. Sobhana K. Nair finds that on the ground, people are angry, confused, and worried about the implications of not ‘making it’ to the list

title: Kanwariyas ‘beat up’ man in Uttar Pradesh’s Muzaffarnagar following minor collision
content: Circle Officer Raju Kumar Sav told reporters that on receiving information about the incident, police immediately rushed to the spot and successfully pacified the irate group of Kanwariyas.

title: In a first, tribal girls from Nilgiris join post-graduate courses in Chennai college
content: A week ago, three tribal girls, including Sijitha and Krishna Priya, from remote villages in the Nilgiris district joined the MCC to pursue post-graduate courses in Tamil and Public Administration

title: Curbs on movement of heavy vehicles hit CNG supply to fuel outlets
content: Many fuel outlets have been facing a dearth in CNG in the past few days. Other problems include delay in obtaining fuel and long queues at bunks

title: NGT orders urgent safety inspection of all firecracker units in Virudhunagar district
content: The teams are directed to work independently and report on licensing compliance, adherence to safety norms, regular inspections by authorities, and any other violations observed during the inspections.

title: MEA slams Punjab CM for mocking PM’s travels to Global South countries
content: Mann said he was not sure which countries the PM had been visiting, referring to them with fictitious names like “Magnesia, Galvesia, Tarvesia”; Government of India calls the comments irresponsible, regrettable

title: Fugitive for 29 years, Coimbatore serial blasts accused ‘Tailor’ Raja lived as chilli trader in Karnataka
content: An alleged former member of the now-banned extremist outfit Al Ummah, Raja kept a low profile and lived a normal life with his wife and children

title: Stalin twisting my remarks on HR and CE-run schools and colleges, says Edappadi Palaniswami
content: He clarifies that the HR and CE Department cannot offer all the facilities by running educational institutions on its own, and only if such institutions are opened as government arts and science colleges, full-fledged amenities can be ensured

title: Watch out for symptoms of Nipah virus infection, no need to panic, says Directorate of Public Health
content: District Health Officers have been told to closely monitor disease prevention measures, particularly in districts adjoining Kerala, the statement says

title: Cuddalore accident: Ashwini Vaishnaw reviews safety issues at level crossings
content: Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw issues directions for provision of CCTV cameras at all level crossings; lowers TVU threshold for safety measures

title: Axiom-4 mission : Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla’s stay in ISS extended, NASA says crew to undock on July 14
content: The Axiom Mission 4 crew was to spend up to 14 days at the ISS, however they will be extending their stay at the ISS

title: Vadodara bridge collapse: Congress flays govt over ‘repeated’ failures, demands SIT probe
content: Party seeks answers from Modi and Amit Shah over the tragedy, seeks resignation of Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel and Home Minister Harsh Sanghavi

title: Migrant workers from West Bengal allege ill-treatment by Odisha Police
content: Workers say alternative document verification unnecessarily prolonged; they never imagined they will be asked to prove Indian nationality

title: Bengal POCSO court awards death sentence to three men in rape and murder case of 15-year-old girl
content: The rape and murder dates back to 2020 in Jalpaiguri; they three men had been accused of abducting the victim, raping and sexually abusing her for days before murdering her

title: BBMP calls for tenders to feed 4,000 stray dogs one meal a day in Bengaluru city
content: Around 100 spots where dogs are not finding adequate food to be identified; up to five dogs to be fed a meal at the spot every day in each zone

title: Defence Ministry identifies domestic firm for S-400 maintenance
content: Russia’s Almaz-Antey, manufacturer of S-400 system, will collaborate with the Indian firm to set up a maintenance, repair and overhaul facility; move will reduce dependence on foreign entities

title: The need to safeguard the right to vote
content: What did the Supreme Court say about electoral rolls revision in Bihar? Is the right to vote a fundamental right in India? Can electoral roll errors invalidate an election? How can India balance electoral vigilance with the inclusion of genuine voters?

title: Aadhaar has been actively used for voter enrolment in earlier elections
content: A glance through the instructions issued by poll panel for the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar shows Aadhaar has been mentioned only once

title: NITI Aayog suggests reduced ‘core’ grant support for State S&T bodies
content: The agency’s report notes Central funds are already a minuscule part of revenue for State Science and Technology Councils; offers more recommendations for better management

title: Three arrested in connection with the death of three members of a family in Belagavi
content: One member of the family, who is recovering in a private hospital after consuming poison, filed the complaint

title: Congress, BJP flay AAP government in Punjab over 11-minute Assembly session
content: Ruling party wraps up Special Session after obituary references; Opposition calls it ‘mockery of democracy’

title: Security beefed up on Kanwar Yatra route across Uttar Pradesh
content: Nearly 587 gazetted officers, 2,040 Inspectors, 13,520 Sub-Inspectors, and 39,965 head constables have been deployed for the yatra, says Government

title: BMRCL, BMTC open transport data; allow Namma Yatri, Tummoc users to coordinate first, last-mile connectivity
content: The apps will utilise real-time data from buses, metro trains operating on user’s route to design a coordinated travel plan

title: AIDWA urges Lokesh to address real problems plaguing schools in A.P.
content: All-India Democratic Women’s Association leaders cite issues like non-payment of salaries to midday meal staff, poor quality of the meal, overburdening of teaching staff and closure of schools in Dalit habitations

title: Centre, UNICEF to provide career counselling for Eklavya tribal school students
content: Tribal students in Eklavya schools will take a common aptitude test which will result in a “career card” suggesting the best career options for each of them; to be paired with career-counselling, life-skills training

title: J&K High Court seeks MHA response on long-term visa status of deported Pakistan woman
content: The petitioner Rakshanda Rashid, a Pakistani citizen married to an Indian, had lived in Jammu for 38 years on an LTV before being deported in the wake of Pahalgam terror attack

title: Shashi Tharoor’s article on Emergency triggers war of words between Congress, BJP
content: While Congress MP Manickam Tagore says when a colleague repeats lines used by BJP, the bird becomes a parrot, BJP says such comments reflect Congress’ mindset

title: Uttarakhand to launch ‘Operation Kalanemi’ against fake saints
content: CM Dhami says impersonators mislead devotees, harm religious sentiment and distort image of Sanatana Dharma

title: A.P. govt. releases new Revenue Manual aimed at streamlining land laws
content: It acts as a roadmap to eliminate deviation and ignorance in implementing the laws, including the crucial aspects of settlements, assignments, land acquisition and Record of Rights
